Write a summary about 'astronomy'. Limit the output to 150 words. Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects and phenomena that originate outside the Earth's atmosphere. It involves physics, mathematics, and chemistry to explain the origin, evolution, and fate of objects and events in the universe. Key areas include the study of stars, galaxies, planets, and cosmic phenomena such as black holes and supernovae. Astronomy also explores the universe's large-scale structure and dynamics, as well as its origin and evolution. The field has significantly advanced our understanding of the universe, with recent discoveries including exoplanets and the accelerating expansion of the universe.

It is one of the oldest sciences, dating back to ancient civilizations. Astronomers study the properties, interactions, and movement of celestial bodies such as stars, galaxies, and planets, using mathematical models and observational data from telescopes and other instruments. Key areas of study include cosmology (the origin and evolution of the universe), astrophysics (the physical properties of celestial objects), and planetary science (the study of planets, moons, and other bodies in our solar system). Astronomy has greatly advanced our understanding of the universe, from discovering the age and scale of the cosmos to uncovering the existence of exoplanets. It continues to be a vibrant and active field, with ongoing research driven by new technological advancements.

It involves physics, mathematics, and chemistry. Key areas include observational astronomy, which collects and analyzes data from telescopes, and theoretical astronomy, which develops and tests models to explain observations.
